IRS990EZ.PrimaryExemptPurpose: Medical and health training and education

ProgramServiceAccomplishment.DescriptionProgramServiceAccom:
Haiti Disaster Medical Relief/Training (January, February, October 2010)
3 teams (medical relief and medical training), sent after major Jan/2010 earthquake, composed of medical and public health professionals, social workers, and EMT's, which treated hundreds of patients

India Wellness Center (Mammallapuram, Tamil Nadu, India)Helped to build a health education and wellness training center in a remote areaSupported a local family to manage this facility
This facility is helping to increase health and wellness and stability in a poverty-stricken area

Elementary School (Jeeva Jyothi Ministry, Tamil Nadu, India)Built and renovated school buildings for 200 elementary students, since old buildings were condemned, due to asbestos and inadequate facilities
Helped to support health/wellness education for secondary students in same area Helped to build a health education and wellness training center in a remote area

Danielle Seban (Health Training, Torre Pellice, Italy) Supported a local woman to provide health/wellness promotion and education
Ron and Bobbie went to Torre Pellice, Italy, provided week-end of health/wellness training Supported a local family to manage this facility

Paul Wangai (Health Education, Wellness Training, Kenya, Africa)
Supported local people to do health/wellness service and training This facility is helping to increase health and wellness and stability in a poverty-stricken area

Fabiola Castanaza (Scholarship, Costa Rica, Central America)
Provided scholarship funds for this young woman to receive college education, so she can be of service to others upon completion of her studies

Kris Lenart (Wellness Education, Linz, Austria) Provided financial assistance so this Kris and his wife can provide health/wellness education to people in surrounding area Ron and Bobbie travelled to Linz, Austria, provided week-end of health/wellness training

Tropical Medicine Conference, College Place, WA (August, 2010)
Organized and sponsored "Hot Topics In Tropical Medicine," with attendance of about 30 medical professionals from several different countries, including Africa and South America

South Sudan Village Health, Basic Life Support Training (Feb-Mar 2010)
Ron and Gatbel travelled to S Sudan, Ethiopia, S Africa, provided village healthcare and BLS training
Successfully obtained official NGO status from S Sudan government for SHMI
Hilaire Laurent (Haiti Scholarship application) Helped process his application for passport/visa for possible travel to Philippines for college education
Philip Sundaraj (scholarship funds) Provided complete funding for him to finish medical school in Armenia, so he can now serve his people in India, upon completion of his one-year internship
